channel.title: How to attach Tor Browser to HTTP proxy before Tor?
channel.description: I'm running a HTTP proxy at 127.0.0.1 in a workstation. So, how I connect Tor Browser to before it accesses the Tor network? In non-whonix workstation (think debian > whonix-gw) it works well. But in Whonix I can't do it cause of unusual usage of socket file in the browser proxy settings instead of bare gateway proxy IP address and port (see the "anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor considered useless" topic).

item.title: How to attach Tor Browser to HTTP proxy before Tor?
item.dc:creator: ThePowerOfMazda
item.description:
Great thanks. God bless you, Patrick!

item.source: How to attach Tor Browser to HTTP proxy before Tor?

item.title: How to attach Tor Browser to HTTP proxy before Tor?
item.dc:creator: ThePowerOfMazda
item.description:
I’m running a HTTP proxy at 127.0.0.1 in a workstation. So, how I connect Tor Browser to before it accesses the Tor network? In non-whonix workstation (think debian > whonix-gw) it works well. But in Whonix I can’t do it cause of unusual usage of socket file in the browser proxy settings instead of bare gateway proxy IP address and port (see the “anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor considered useless” topic).

Read full topic
item.source: How to attach Tor Browser to HTTP proxy before Tor?
